info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 28 at 4:08PM EDT until June 28 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including the following counties, Alleghany VA and Botetourt.
* WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 408 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.7 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cowpasture River, James River, Craig Creek, Hipes Branch, Dry Creek and Blue Spring Run. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clifton Forge... Iron Gate... Glen Wilton... Low Moor... Gala... Selma... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.
